abstract: President Poincaré gave an interview to the American correspondent Edward Marshall, who was left impressed by the head of state’s gravitas and bearing.
lead_paragraph: PARIS— President Poincaré has received Mr. Edward Marshall, the American newspaper correspondent, and talked with him upon President Wilson’s note and the reply of the Allies.
snippet: President Poincaré gave an interview to the American correspondent Edward Marshall, who was left impressed by the head of state’s gravitas and bearing....

headline.main: 1917: French Leader Addresses American Efforts to End the War
